00128 void InitializeMines( void )
00129 {
00130       UINT8 ubMineIndex;
00131       MINE_STATUS_TYPE *pMineStatus;
00132       UINT8 ubMineProductionIncreases;
00133       UINT8 ubDepletedMineIndex;
00134       UINT8 ubMinDaysBeforeDepletion = 20;
00135 
00136 
00137       // set up initial mine status
00138       for( ubMineIndex = 0; ubMineIndex < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES; ubMineIndex++ )
00139       {
00140             pMineStatus = &(gMineStatus[ ubMineIndex ]);
00141 
00142             memset( pMineStatus, 0, sizeof( *pMineStatus ) );
00143 
00144             pMineStatus->ubMineType = gubMineTypes[ ubMineIndex ];
00145             pMineStatus->uiMaxRemovalRate = guiMinimumMineProduction[ ubMineIndex ];
00146             pMineStatus->fEmpty = (pMineStatus->uiMaxRemovalRate == 0) ? TRUE : FALSE;
00147             pMineStatus->fRunningOut = FALSE;
00148             pMineStatus->fWarnedOfRunningOut = FALSE;
00149 //          pMineStatus->bMonsters = MINES_NO_MONSTERS;
00150             pMineStatus->fShutDown = FALSE;
00151             pMineStatus->fPrevInvadedByMonsters = FALSE;
00152             pMineStatus->fSpokeToHeadMiner = FALSE;
00153             pMineStatus->fMineHasProducedForPlayer = FALSE;
00154             pMineStatus->fQueenRetookProducingMine = FALSE;
00155             gMineStatus->fShutDownIsPermanent = FALSE;
00156       }
00157 
00158       // randomize the exact size each mine.  The total production is always the same and depends on the game difficulty,
00159       // but some mines will produce more in one game than another, while others produce less
00160 
00161       // adjust for game difficulty
00162       switch( gGameOptions.ubDifficultyLevel )
00163       {
00164             case DIF_LEVEL_EASY:
00165             case DIF_LEVEL_MEDIUM:
00166                   ubMineProductionIncreases = 25;
00167                   break;
00168             case DIF_LEVEL_HARD:
00169                   ubMineProductionIncreases = 20;
00170                   break;
00171             case DIF_LEVEL_INSANE:
00172                   ubMineProductionIncreases = 15;
00173                   break;
00174             default:
00175                   Assert( 0 );
00176                   return;
00177       }
00178 
00179       while (ubMineProductionIncreases > 0)
00180       {
00181             // pick a producing mine at random and increase its production
00182             do
00183             {
00184                   ubMineIndex = ( UINT8 ) Random(MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES);
00185             } while (gMineStatus[ubMineIndex].fEmpty);
00186 
00187             // increase mine production by 20% of the base (minimum) rate
00188             gMineStatus[ubMineIndex].uiMaxRemovalRate += (guiMinimumMineProduction[ubMineIndex] / 5);
00189 
00190             ubMineProductionIncreases--;
00191       }
00192 
00193 
00194       // choose which mine will run out of production.  This will never be the Alma mine or an empty mine (San Mona)...
00195       do
00196       {
00197             ubDepletedMineIndex = ( UINT8 ) Random(MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES);
00198             // Alma mine can't run out for quest-related reasons (see Ian)
00199       } while (gMineStatus[ubDepletedMineIndex].fEmpty || (ubDepletedMineIndex == MINE_ALMA));
00200 
00201 
00202       for( ubMineIndex = 0; ubMineIndex < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES; ubMineIndex++ )
00203       {
00204             pMineStatus = &(gMineStatus[ ubMineIndex ]);
00205 
00206             if (ubMineIndex == ubDepletedMineIndex)
00207             {
00208                   if ( ubDepletedMineIndex == MINE_DRASSEN )
00209                   {
00210                         ubMinDaysBeforeDepletion = 20;
00211                   }
00212                   else
00213                   {
00214                         ubMinDaysBeforeDepletion = 10;
00215                   }
00216 
00217                   // the mine that runs out has only enough ore for this many days of full production
00218                   pMineStatus->uiRemainingOreSupply = ubMinDaysBeforeDepletion * (MINE_PRODUCTION_NUMBER_OF_PERIODS * pMineStatus->uiMaxRemovalRate);
00219 
00220                   // ore starts running out when reserves drop to less than 25% of the initial supply
00221                   pMineStatus->uiOreRunningOutPoint = pMineStatus->uiRemainingOreSupply / 4;
00222             }
00223             else
00224             if (!pMineStatus->fEmpty)
00225             {
00226                   // never runs out...
00227                   pMineStatus->uiRemainingOreSupply = 999999999;        // essentially unlimited
00228                   pMineStatus->uiOreRunningOutPoint = 0;
00229             }
00230             else
00231             {
00232                   // already empty
00233                   pMineStatus->uiRemainingOreSupply = 0;
00234                   pMineStatus->uiOreRunningOutPoint = 0;
00235             }
00236       }
00237 }

00240 void HourlyMinesUpdate(void)
00241 {
00242       UINT8 ubMineIndex;
00243       MINE_STATUS_TYPE *pMineStatus;
00244       UINT8 ubQuoteType;
00245 
00246 
00247       // check every non-empty mine
00248       for( ubMineIndex = 0; ubMineIndex < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES; ubMineIndex++ )
00249       {
00250             pMineStatus = &(gMineStatus[ ubMineIndex ]);
00251 
00252             if (pMineStatus->fEmpty)
00253             {
00254                   // nobody is working that mine, so who cares
00255                   continue;
00256             }
00257 
00258             // check if the mine has any monster creatures in it
00259             if (MineClearOfMonsters( ubMineIndex ))
00260             {
00261                   // if it's shutdown, but not permanently
00262                   if (IsMineShutDown( ubMineIndex ) && !pMineStatus->fShutDownIsPermanent)
00263                   {
00264                         // if we control production in it
00265                         if (PlayerControlsMine( ubMineIndex ))
00266                         {
00267                               IssueHeadMinerQuote( ubMineIndex, HEAD_MINER_STRATEGIC_QUOTE_CREATURES_GONE );
00268                         }
00269 
00270                         //Force the creatures to avoid the mine for a period of time.  This gives the 
00271                         //player a chance to rest and decide how to deal with the problem.
00272                         ForceCreaturesToAvoidMineTemporarily( ubMineIndex );
00273 
00274                         // put mine back in service
00275                         RestartMineProduction( ubMineIndex );
00276                   }
00277             }
00278             else  // mine is monster infested
00279             {
00280                   // 'Der be monsters crawling around in there, lad!!!
00281                   
00282                   // if it's still producing
00283                   if (!IsMineShutDown( ubMineIndex ))
00284                   {
00285                         // gotta put a stop to that!
00286 
00287                         // if we control production in it
00288                         if (PlayerControlsMine( ubMineIndex ))
00289                         {
00290                               // 2 different quotes, depends whether or not it's the first time this has happened
00291                               if (pMineStatus->fPrevInvadedByMonsters)
00292                               {
00293                                     ubQuoteType = HEAD_MINER_STRATEGIC_QUOTE_CREATURES_AGAIN;
00294                               }
00295                               else
00296                               {
00297                                     ubQuoteType = HEAD_MINER_STRATEGIC_QUOTE_CREATURES_ATTACK;
00298                                     pMineStatus->fPrevInvadedByMonsters = TRUE;
00299 
00300                                     if ( gubQuest[ QUEST_CREATURES ] == QUESTNOTSTARTED )
00301                                     {
00302                                           // start it now!
00303                                           StartQuest( QUEST_CREATURES, gMineLocation[ ubMineIndex ].sSectorX, gMineLocation[ ubMineIndex ].sSectorY );
00304                                     }
00305                               }
00306 
00307                               // tell player the good news...
00308                               IssueHeadMinerQuote( ubMineIndex, ubQuoteType );
00309                         }
00310 
00311                         // and immediately halt all work at the mine (whether it's ours or the queen's).  This is a temporary shutdown
00312                         ShutOffMineProduction( ubMineIndex );
00313                   }
00314             }
00315       }
00316 }

00400 UINT32 ExtractOreFromMine( INT8 bMineIndex, UINT32 uiAmount )
00401 {
00402       // will remove the ore from the mine and return the amount that was removed
00403       UINT32 uiAmountExtracted = 0;
00404       UINT32 uiOreRunningOutPoint = 0;
00405       INT16 sSectorX, sSectorY;
00406 
00407 
00408       Assert( ( bMineIndex >= 0 ) && ( bMineIndex < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES ) );
00409 
00410       // if mine is shut down
00411       if ( gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fShutDown)
00412       {
00413             return ( 0 );
00414       }
00415 
00416       // if not capable of extracting anything, bail now
00417       if (uiAmount == 0)
00418       {
00419             return ( 0 );
00420       }
00421 
00422       // will this exhaust the ore in this mine?
00423       if( uiAmount >= gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiRemainingOreSupply )
00424       {
00425             // exhaust remaining ore
00426             uiAmountExtracted = gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiRemainingOreSupply;
00427             gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiRemainingOreSupply = 0;
00428             gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiMaxRemovalRate = 0;
00429             gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fEmpty = TRUE;
00430             gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fRunningOut = FALSE;
00431 
00432             // tell the strategic AI about this, that mine's and town's value is greatly reduced
00433             GetMineSector( bMineIndex, &sSectorX, &sSectorY );
00434             StrategicHandleMineThatRanOut( ( UINT8 ) SECTOR( sSectorX, sSectorY ) );
00435 
00436             AddHistoryToPlayersLog( HISTORY_MINE_RAN_OUT, gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].bAssociatedTown, GetWorldTotalMin( ), gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].sSectorX,  gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].sSectorY );
00437       }
00438       else  // still some left after this extraction
00439       {
00440             // set amount used, and decrement ore remaining in mine     
00441             uiAmountExtracted = uiAmount;
00442             gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiRemainingOreSupply -= uiAmount;
00443 
00444             // one of the mines (randomly chosen) will start running out eventually, check if we're there yet
00445             if (gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiRemainingOreSupply < gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiOreRunningOutPoint)
00446             {
00447                   gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fRunningOut = TRUE;
00448 
00449                   // round all fractions UP to the next REMOVAL_RATE_INCREMENT
00450                   gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiMaxRemovalRate = (UINT32) (((FLOAT) gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiRemainingOreSupply / 10) / REMOVAL_RATE_INCREMENT + 0.9999) * REMOVAL_RATE_INCREMENT;
00451 
00452 
00453                   // if we control it
00454                   if (PlayerControlsMine(bMineIndex))
00455                   {
00456                         // and haven't yet been warned that it's running out
00457                         if (!gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fWarnedOfRunningOut)
00458                         {
00459                               // that mine's head miner tells player that the mine is running out
00460                               IssueHeadMinerQuote( bMineIndex, HEAD_MINER_STRATEGIC_QUOTE_RUNNING_OUT );
00461                               gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fWarnedOfRunningOut = TRUE;
00462                               AddHistoryToPlayersLog( HISTORY_MINE_RUNNING_OUT, gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].bAssociatedTown, GetWorldTotalMin( ), gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].sSectorX,  gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].sSectorY );
00463                         }
00464                   }
00465             }
00466       }
00467 
00468       return( uiAmountExtracted );
00469 }

00471 INT32 GetAvailableWorkForceForMineForPlayer( INT8 bMineIndex )
00472 {
00473       // look for available workforce in the town associated with the mine
00474       INT32 iWorkForceSize = 0;
00475       INT8 bTownId = 0;
00476 
00477       // return the loyalty of the town associated with the mine
00478       
00479       Assert( ( bMineIndex >= 0 ) && ( bMineIndex < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES ) );
00480 
00481       // if mine is shut down
00482       if ( gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fShutDown)
00483       {
00484             return ( 0 );
00485       }
00486 
00487       // until the player contacts the head miner, production in mine ceases if in player's control
00488       if ( !gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fSpokeToHeadMiner)
00489       {
00490             return ( 0 );
00491       }
00492       
00493 
00494       bTownId = gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].bAssociatedTown;
00495 
00496       Assert ( GetTownSectorSize( bTownId ) != 0 );
00497 
00498 
00499       // get workforce size (is 0-100 based on local town's loyalty)
00500       iWorkForceSize = gTownLoyalty[ bTownId ].ubRating;
00501 
00502 /*    
00503       // adjust for monster infestation
00504       iWorkForceSize *= gubMonsterMineInfestation[ gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].bMonsters ];
00505       iWorkForceSize /= 100;
00506 */
00507 
00508       // now adjust for town size.. the number of sectors you control
00509       iWorkForceSize *= GetTownSectorsUnderControl( bTownId );
00510       iWorkForceSize /= GetTownSectorSize( bTownId );
00511 
00512       return ( iWorkForceSize );
00513 }
00514 
00515 INT32 GetAvailableWorkForceForMineForEnemy( INT8 bMineIndex )
00516 {
00517       // look for available workforce in the town associated with the mine
00518       INT32 iWorkForceSize = 0;
00519       INT8 bTownId = 0;
00520 
00521       // return the loyalty of the town associated with the mine
00522       
00523       Assert( ( bMineIndex >= 0 ) && ( bMineIndex < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES ) );
00524 
00525       // if mine is shut down
00526       if ( gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fShutDown)
00527       {
00528             return ( 0 );
00529       }
00530 
00531       bTownId = gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].bAssociatedTown;
00532 
00533       if( GetTownSectorSize( bTownId )  == 0 )
00534       {
00535             return 0;
00536       }
00537 
00538       // get workforce size (is 0-100 based on REVERSE of local town's loyalty)
00539       iWorkForceSize = 100 - gTownLoyalty[ bTownId ].ubRating;
00540 
00541 /*    
00542       // adjust for monster infestation
00543       iWorkForceSize *= gubMonsterMineInfestation[ gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].bMonsters ];
00544       iWorkForceSize /= 100;
00545 */
00546 
00547       // now adjust for town size.. the number of sectors you control
00548       iWorkForceSize *= ( GetTownSectorSize( bTownId ) - GetTownSectorsUnderControl( bTownId ) );
00549       iWorkForceSize /= GetTownSectorSize( bTownId );
00550 
00551       return ( iWorkForceSize );
00552 }

00576 INT32 MineAMine( INT8 bMineIndex )
00577 {
00578       // will extract ore based on available workforce, and increment players income based on amount
00579       INT8 bMineType = 0;
00580       INT32 iAmtExtracted = 0;
00581 
00582 
00583       Assert( ( bMineIndex >= 0 ) && ( bMineIndex < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES ) );
00584 
00585       // is mine is empty
00586       if( gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fEmpty)
00587       {
00588             return 0;
00589       }
00590 
00591       // if mine is shut down
00592       if ( gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fShutDown)
00593       {
00594             return 0;
00595       }
00596 
00597 
00598       // who controls the PRODUCTION in the mine ?  (Queen receives production unless player has spoken to the head miner)
00599       if( PlayerControlsMine(bMineIndex) )
00600       {
00601             // player controlled
00602             iAmtExtracted = ExtractOreFromMine( bMineIndex , GetCurrentWorkRateOfMineForPlayer( bMineIndex ) );
00603 
00604             // SHOW ME THE MONEY!!!!
00605             if( iAmtExtracted > 0 )
00606             {
00607                   // debug message
00608 //                ScreenMsg( MSG_FONT_RED, MSG_DEBUG, L"%s - Mine income from %s = $%d", WORLDTIMESTR, pTownNames[ GetTownAssociatedWithMine( bMineIndex ) ], iAmtExtracted );
00609 
00610                   // check type of mine
00611                   bMineType = gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].ubMineType;
00612 
00613                   // if this is the first time this mine has produced income for the player in the game
00614                   if ( !gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fMineHasProducedForPlayer )
00615                   {
00616                         // remember that we've earned income from this mine during the game
00617                         gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fMineHasProducedForPlayer = TRUE;
00618                         // and when we started to do so...
00619                         gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiTimePlayerProductionStarted = GetWorldTotalMin();
00620                   }
00621             }
00622       }
00623       else  // queen controlled
00624       {
00625             // we didn't want mines to run out without player ever even going to them, so now the queen doesn't reduce the
00626             // amount remaining until the mine has produced for the player first (so she'd have to capture it).
00627             if ( gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].fMineHasProducedForPlayer )
00628             {
00629                   // don't actually give her money, just take production away
00630                   iAmtExtracted = ExtractOreFromMine( bMineIndex , GetCurrentWorkRateOfMineForEnemy( bMineIndex ) );
00631             }
00632       }
00633 
00634 
00635       return iAmtExtracted;
00636 }

00667 
00668 UINT32 PredictDailyIncomeFromAMine( INT8 bMineIndex )
00669 {
00670       // predict income from this mine, estimate assumes mining situation will not change during next 4 income periods
00671       // (miner loyalty, % town controlled, monster infestation level, and current max removal rate may all in fact change)
00672       UINT32 uiAmtExtracted = 0;
00673 
00674       if(PlayerControlsMine(bMineIndex))
00675       {
00676             // get daily income for this mine (regardless of what time of day it currently is)
00677             uiAmtExtracted = MINE_PRODUCTION_NUMBER_OF_PERIODS * GetCurrentWorkRateOfMineForPlayer( bMineIndex );
00678 
00679             // check if we will take more than there is
00680             if( uiAmtExtracted > gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiRemainingOreSupply )
00681             {
00682                   // yes reduce to value of mine
00683                   uiAmtExtracted = gMineStatus[ bMineIndex ].uiRemainingOreSupply;
00684             }
00685       }
00686       
00687       return( uiAmtExtracted );
00688 }

00707 {

00712       for( bCounter = 0; bCounter < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES; bCounter++ )
00713       {

00928 void IssueHeadMinerQuote( INT8 bMineIndex, UINT8 ubQuoteType )
00929 {
00930       UINT8 ubHeadMinerIndex = 0;
00931       UINT16 usHeadMinerProfileId = 0;
00932       INT8 bQuoteNum = 0;
00933       UINT8 ubFaceIndex = 0;
00934       BOOLEAN fForceMapscreen = FALSE;
00935       INT16 sXPos, sYPos;
00936 
00937 
00938       Assert( ( bMineIndex >= 0 ) && ( bMineIndex < MAX_NUMBER_OF_MINES ) );
00939       Assert( ubQuoteType < NUM_HEAD_MINER_STRATEGIC_QUOTES );
00940       Assert( CheckFact( FACT_MINERS_PLACED, 0 ) );
00941 
00942       ubHeadMinerIndex = GetHeadMinerIndexForMine( bMineIndex );
00943       usHeadMinerProfileId = gHeadMinerData[ ubHeadMinerIndex ].usProfileId;
00944 
00945       // make sure the miner ain't dead
00946       if (gMercProfiles[ usHeadMinerProfileId ].bLife < OKLIFE)
00947       {
00948             // debug message
00949             ScreenMsg( MSG_FONT_RED, MSG_DEBUG, L"Head Miner #%s can't talk (quote #%d)", gMercProfiles[ usHeadMinerProfileId ].zNickname, ubQuoteType);
00950             return;
00951       }
00952 
00953       bQuoteNum = gHeadMinerData[ ubHeadMinerIndex ].bQuoteNum[ ubQuoteType ];
00954       Assert( bQuoteNum != -1 );
00955 
00956       ubFaceIndex = ( UINT8 ) uiExternalStaticNPCFaces[ gHeadMinerData[ ubHeadMinerIndex ].ubExternalFace ];
00957 
00958       // transition to mapscreen is not necessary for "creatures gone" quote - player is IN that mine, so he'll know
00959       if ( ubQuoteType != HEAD_MINER_STRATEGIC_QUOTE_CREATURES_GONE )
00960       {
00961             fForceMapscreen = TRUE;
00962       }
00963 
00964 
00965       // decide where the miner's face and text box should be positioned in order to not obscure the mine he's in as it flashes
00966       switch ( bMineIndex )
00967       {
00968             case MINE_GRUMM:
00969                   sXPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_X_POS, sYPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_Y_POS;
00970                   break;
00971             case MINE_CAMBRIA:
00972                   sXPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_X_POS, sYPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_Y_POS;
00973                   break;
00974             case MINE_ALMA:
00975                   sXPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_X_POS, sYPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_Y_POS;
00976                   break;
00977             case MINE_DRASSEN:
00978                   sXPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_X_POS, sYPos = 135;
00979                   break;
00980             case MINE_CHITZENA:
00981                   sXPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_X_POS, sYPos = 117;
00982                   break;
00983 
00984             // there's no head miner in San Mona, this is an error!
00985             case MINE_SAN_MONA:
00986             default:
00987                   Assert( FALSE );
00988                   sXPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_X_POS, sYPos = DEFAULT_EXTERN_PANEL_Y_POS;
00989                   break;
00990       }
00991 
00992       SetExternMapscreenSpeechPanelXY( sXPos, sYPos );
00993 
00994       // cause this quote to come up for this profile id and an indicator to flash over the mine sector
00995       HandleMinerEvent( gHeadMinerData[ ubHeadMinerIndex ].ubExternalFace, gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].sSectorX, gMineLocation[ bMineIndex ].sSectorY, (INT16) bQuoteNum, fForceMapscreen );
00996 
00997       // stop time compression with any miner quote - these are important events.
00998       StopTimeCompression();
00999 }

01150 void PlayerAttackedHeadMiner( UINT8 ubMinerProfileId )
01151 {
01152       UINT8 ubMineIndex;
01153       INT8 bTownId;
01154 
01155       // get the index of his mine
01156       ubMineIndex = GetHeadMinersMineIndex( ubMinerProfileId );
01157 
01158 
01159       // if it's the first time he's been attacked
01160       if ( gMineStatus[ ubMineIndex ].fAttackedHeadMiner == FALSE )
01161       {
01162             // shut off production at his mine (Permanently!)
01163             ShutOffMineProduction( ubMineIndex );
01164             MineShutdownIsPermanent( ubMineIndex );
01165 
01166             // get the index of his town
01167             bTownId = GetTownAssociatedWithMine( ubMineIndex );
01168             // penalize associated town's loyalty
01169             DecrementTownLoyalty( bTownId, LOYALTY_PENALTY_HEAD_MINER_ATTACKED );
01170 
01171             // don't allow this more than once
01172             gMineStatus[ ubMineIndex ].fAttackedHeadMiner = TRUE;
01173       }
01174 }

01191 
01192 // gte the id of the mine for this sector x,y,z...-1 is invalid
01193 INT8 GetIdOfMineForSector( INT16 sSectorX, INT16 sSectorY, INT8 bSectorZ )
01194 {
01195       INT8 bMineIndex = -1;
01196       INT16 sSectorValue;
01197 
01198 
01199       // are we even on the right level?
01200       if( ( bSectorZ < 0 ) && ( bSectorZ > 2 ) )
01201       {
01202             // nope
01203             return( -1 );
01204       }
01205 
01206       // now get the sectorvalue
01207       sSectorValue = SECTOR( sSectorX, sSectorY );
01208 
01209       // support surface
01210       if( bSectorZ == 0 )
01211       {
01212             bMineIndex = GetMineIndexForSector( sSectorX, sSectorY );
01213       }
01214       // handle for first level
01215       else if( bSectorZ == 1 )
01216       {
01217             switch( sSectorValue )
01218             {
01219                   // grumm
01220                   case( SEC_H3 ):
01221                   case( SEC_I3 ):
01222                         bMineIndex = MINE_GRUMM;
01223                   break;
01224                   // cambria
01225                   case( SEC_H8 ):
01226                   case( SEC_H9 ):
01227                         bMineIndex = MINE_CAMBRIA;
01228                   break;
01229                   // alma
01230                   case( SEC_I14 ):
01231                   case( SEC_J14 ):
01232                         bMineIndex = MINE_ALMA;
01233                   break;
01234                   // drassen
01235                   case( SEC_D13 ):
01236                   case( SEC_E13 ):
01237                         bMineIndex = MINE_DRASSEN;
